justification: com.google.googlejavaformat.intellij has Ce=1 and Ca=0 => instability I = 0/(0+1) = 0 (very unstable). Its sole outgoing dependency is com.google.googlejavaformat.java which has Ce=2 and Ca=2 => instability I = 2/(2+2) = 0.5 (more stable). There are no incoming dependencies to com.google.googlejavaformat.intellij (Ca=0). Because the package depends on a more stable package (0.5 > 0), the Stable Dependencies Principle is respected and no Unstable Dependency smell is detected.

Analyzed package has Ce=2, Ca=2 (Instability I=2/(2+2)=0.5). Its outgoing dependencies: com.google.googlejavaformat.java.javadoc (Ce=0, Ca=1, I=0.0) and com.google.googlejavaformat (Ce=0, Ca=1, I=0.0) are more stable (I=0.0 < 0.5). Incoming dependents: com.google.googlejavaformat.java.filer (Ce=1, Ca=0, I=1.0) and com.google.googlejavaformat.intellij (Ce=1, Ca=0, I=1.0) are less stable and depend on this package, which is the correct stability direction. Therefore there is no unstable dependency (package does not depend on less stable packages).

The analyzed package has Ce=1 and Ca=0 -> instability I = Ce/(Ca+Ce) = 1/(0+1) = 1.0 (highly unstable). Its outgoing dependency com.google.googlejavaformat.java has Ce=2 and Ca=2 -> instability I = 2/(2+2) = 0.5 (more stable). Because the package depends on a more stable package (I 1.0 -> I 0.5), it does not violate the Stable Dependencies Principle. Incoming dependencies are empty (Ca=0), so there is no evidence of an unstable dependency smell.

The package has no outgoing dependencies (Ce = 0) and one incoming dependency (Ca = 1). Because Ce = 0 and Ca = 1 its instability I = 0/(0+1) = 0 (maximally stable). The only incoming dependency is from com.google.googlejavaformat.java (Ce = 2, Ca = 2, instability = 2/(2+2) = 0.5). The analyzed package does not depend on any less-stable packages (no outgoing deps), and the dependency direction (com.google.googlejavaformat.java -> com.google.googlejavaformat) is from a less stable package to a more stable one, which conforms to the Stable Dependencies Principle; therefore there is no Unstable Dependency smell.

com.google.googlejavaformat.java.javadoc has no outgoing dependencies (outgoing_dependencies = [], Ce = 0) and a single incoming dependency (Ca = 1). Its instability I = Ce/(Ce+Ca) = 0/(0+1) = 0, indicating maximal stability. Since the package does not depend on any other packages, it cannot depend on less stable packages, so the Unstable Dependency smell is not present.
